instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
Hi,
This board had few small spots of water damage, I repaired them, and now I have chime, orange light on charger, but no display on mini display port. Internal display is ok, blinking folder.

<RESISTOR>R5350</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5351</RESISTOR> are ok, 2 kohm, voltage on all their pins is 3.4V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3RHV_S4_TBTBPWR_F</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL> =0V
<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> =0V
<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> =3.3V

<RESISTOR>R2887</RESISTOR>=10 kohm

Any idea how to continue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
HDMI also not working?
Thunderbolt problems usually not worth to spend time only for external video.

Check <SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U3220</CHIP>/320, depending which port used.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message: HDMI is not able to display the blinking folder, correct? I should test from OS X?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
So, for what I have checked also with another board, there is no blinking folder possible on HDMI.
For this board HDMI is working, within OS X

With display port connected on A:
<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HPD</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>DP_TBTPA_HPD</SIGNAL> =3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message: Any idea to try to solve this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>15V_TBT</SIGNAL> is there?
Do you get voltage at <CAPACITOR>C3211</CAPACITOR>/86?
Check the other port too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL> = 0V, with or without cable connected
In diode mode, I have 0.56V on <CAPACITOR>C3315</CAPACITOR>
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V, with or without cable connected
also,
<SIGNAL>TBT_B_HV_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V, with or without cable connected

Port A:
On <CAPACITOR>C3286</CAPACITOR>: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR</SIGNAL> =3.3V
On <CAPACITOR>C3211</CAPACITOR>: <SIGNAL>PP3V3RHV_S4_TBTAPWR</SIGNAL> =3.3V
Port B:
On <CAPACITOR>C3386</CAPACITOR>: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBTBPWR</SIGNAL> =3.3V
On <CAPACITOR>C3311</CAPACITOR>: <SIGNAL>PP3V3RHV_S4_TBTBPWR</SIGNAL>=3.3V
I have these values with or without cable connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message: Check if <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> gets all required voltages (page 24).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
Here are the voltages on <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTRDV</SIGNAL> = 1.01V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBT</SIGNAL> = 1.01V
<SIGNAL>P1V05TBT_SW</SIGNAL> = 0.95V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTCIO</SIGNAL> = 1.00V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBT</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBT_F</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTRDV</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

<SIGNAL>TBT_EN_CIO_PWR_L</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>TBT_PWR_REQ_L</SIGNAL> = 0V

Seems ok. I have these values with or without cable connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>TBT_POC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>TBT_PWR_ON_POC_RST_L</SIGNAL>.

You can try changing/reflashing <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>.
If still the same, change <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>TBT_POC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>TBT_PWR_ON_POC_RST_L</SIGNAL>  = 3.3V

Can I try to replace with <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> from a spare <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, also with 2 display ports?
Do you have a dump for this chip?
I can flash with the same tool I use for SPI ROM/BIOS, correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message: <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> is a SPI chip; any BIOS programmer should do the job.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
Ok.
Can I try to replace <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> with the same chip from a spare <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, also with 2 display ports?
Do you have a dump for this chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
I don't have TBT ROM for these old machines.

Don't forget to make backup of them first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message: Ok, last question:  can I try to replace <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> with the same chip from a spare <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, also with 2 display ports?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on mini display port
threads.message:
You can try, but...
If doesn't work, you can't be sure if is incompatible, or board has other problem,
